meanings.definition: Not able to be fixed or restored.
meanings.sent1: The broken toy was unrepair, so I had to throw it away.
meanings.sent2: The unrepair car was beyond saving, and we had to buy a new one.
meanings.sent3: The unrepair clock kept ticking backwards, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt unrepair after the painful breakup, like shattered glass.
meanings.sent5: The unrepair bridge stood as a reminder of the destructive storm.

meanings.definition: To not be able to fix or restore something.
meanings.sent1: I tried to unrepair the leaky faucet, but it kept dripping.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic could not unrepair the engine, so we had to replace it.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally unrepair the computer while trying to upgrade it.
meanings.sent4: The storm's damage unrepair the roof, leaving it vulnerable to leaks.
meanings.sent5: Despite his efforts, he could not unrepair the relationship with his friend.
